item.title: Report X-2025041364
item.description:
Report X-2025041364

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-14
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO OF DELAWARE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO PD1 FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND FLAMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET RESPONDER PLACED LEAKING PACKAGE IN SPILL TUB AND CLEANED UP SPILL. THE LEAKER AND CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025040583
item.description:
Report E-2025040583

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-28
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 1-gallon plastic pails due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pails being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer and dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: Facility personnel reported a leak from IM tank RMCU10056. Upon investigation by a contractor it was determined the leak was the result of the Manway Gasket not properly installed which allowed product to leak out when lifted from chassis prior to loading into railroad well car.

item.title: Report X-2025041197
item.description:
Report X-2025041197

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/14/2025 at approximately 1745, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5105681 at the station location in Kansas City, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of two cans of paint packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered emitting a strong odor at the facility. Further investigation revealed that paint had spilled inside of its inner packaging and contained. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA. All measurements mentioned in this report are estimated due to the missing information.

item.title: Report X-2025040970
item.description:
Report X-2025040970

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING AN ALCOHOL-LIKE ODOR BY A SORTER ON BOXLINE-3. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR AND EVACUATED THE AREA. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 POLY 4-LITER CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APROXIMATELY 6 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO A SIDEWALL OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CONTAINMENT WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.
